text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Greek Cypriot press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Turkish Cypriot leader Rauf Denktash retaliates to protests to discourage tourist visits, closing the checkpoint to enclaved Greek Cypriots due to return home.
- Bill Clinton's re-election is an opportunity for Cyprus, says the government.
- The cooperation between Disy and Diko parties in municipal elections runs up against problems because of the Paphos candidate.
- Israelis get four years in jail for escaping to the north.
- Cyprus's electricity authority faces a barrage of charges it bent rules in a consultancy tender to a company belonging to a member of its board.
- The government adopts a wait-and-see approach to Bill Clinton's re-election.
- The government is to attempt a cost-cutting drive at Cyprus Airways which announced losses of 2.9 million pounds ($6.25 million) in the first half of the year.
